sections.title: Key Mortgage Terms
content: Principal: The loan amount borrowed to purchase the home
Interest Rate: Annual percentage rate (APR) charged by the lender
Down Payment: Upfront payment, typically 10-20% of home price
Loan Term: Repayment period, commonly 15 or 30 years
PMI: Private mortgage insurance required if down payment < 20%

sections.title: Tips for Better Mortgage Rates
content: Make a larger down payment to reduce loan amount and avoid PMI
Choose shorter loan terms (15 years) for lower total interest
Improve credit score before applying for better rates
Shop around with multiple lenders for competitive rates
Consider paying points to reduce interest rate

sections.title: Additional Costs to Consider
content: Property taxes - varies by location and home value
Homeowners insurance - protects against damage and liability
HOA fees - monthly/annual homeowners association dues
Closing costs - typically 2-5% of home purchase price
Maintenance and repairs - budget 1-3% of home value annually
